result.purpose: This project is a wallet manager for decentralized applications (dApps) that facilitates user interactions with blockchain networks, including managing accounts, preferences, and announcements. It provides a secure API for signing transactions and handling user authentication while integrating with various external services like Binance and Moonpay.
result.architecture: The project follows a modular architecture pattern, utilizing microservices for different functionalities such as user management, announcement handling, and device management, all orchestrated through an Echo web server framework.

.github.purpose: Contains templates and configurations for GitHub repository management
.github.architecture: The folder follows a simple structure for managing GitHub-related documentation and templates.

.github/pull_request_template.md.purpose: Template for pull requests in a GitHub repository

.github/workflows.purpose: This folder is responsible for defining GitHub Actions workflows for various automation tasks related to CI/CD processes.
.github/workflows.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, where each YAML file defines a specific workflow for automation tasks, allowing for easy integration and management of CI/CD processes.

.github/workflows/check.yml.purpose: Defines a GitHub Actions workflow for security scanning on pull requests to the develop branch.

.github/workflows/dockerize.yml.purpose: Defines a GitHub Actions workflow for Dockerizing a mobile wallet manager.
side_effects: Triggers on push and pull request events
Uses secrets for secure operations
risks: Exposure of sensitive information if secrets are not managed properly

.github/workflows/golangci-lint.yml.purpose: Configuration file for the golangci-lint GitHub Action workflow.

.github/workflows/sentry.yml.purpose: Defines a GitHub Actions workflow for Sentry release management.

cmd/app.purpose: This folder/module is responsible for setting up and running the main application, including an HTTP server and a metrics server.
cmd/app.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, where the main application logic is encapsulated in a single entry point (main.go) that initializes and manages various components such as HTTP and metrics servers.

cmd/app/main.go.purpose: This file sets up an HTTP server and a metrics server, handling graceful shutdown and middleware integration.
side_effects: Initializes Sentry for error tracking if enabled
Starts HTTP and metrics servers
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive information in logs if not properly configured
Dependency on external services (e.g., Sentry) for error tracking

cmd/clean_cronjob.purpose: This folder/module is responsible for implementing a cron job that cleans old announcements from a database.
cmd/clean_cronjob.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, where the main file orchestrates the initialization of services and database connections, and handles the execution of the cron job functionality.

cmd/clean_cronjob/main.go.purpose: This file implements a cron job that cleans old announcements from a database.
side_effects: Initializes Sentry for error tracking
Connects to PostgreSQL database
Connects to Redis database
Cleans old cron jobs from the database
risks: Potential failure in Sentry initialization
Database connection failures
Error handling may not cover all edge cases

cmd/clean_highlight_dapps.purpose: This folder/module is responsible for a command-line application that cleans expired highlights from a database.
cmd/clean_highlight_dapps.architecture: The folder follows a command-line application architecture, utilizing a main function to orchestrate the initialization of services and database connections, and executing the cleaning of expired highlights.

cmd/clean_highlight_dapps/main.go.purpose: This file contains the main function for a command-line application that cleans expired highlights from a database.
side_effects: Initializes Sentry for error tracking
Connects to PostgreSQL database
Connects to Redis database
Cleans expired highlights from the database
risks: Potential failure in Sentry initialization
Database connection failures
Error handling for cleaning highlights may not be robust

cmd/clean_old_special_offers.purpose: Cleans old special offers from a database based on a specified time period.
cmd/clean_old_special_offers.architecture: The folder follows a command-line application architecture, where the main function orchestrates the cleaning process by initializing necessary services and executing the core functionality.

cmd/clean_old_special_offers/main.go.purpose: Cleans old special offers from a database based on a specified time period.
side_effects: Initializes Sentry for error tracking
Connects to a PostgreSQL database
Modifies the database by clearing old special offers
risks: Potential database connection failure
Error handling may not cover all edge cases
Sentry initialization failure may go unreported

cmd/ip_location.purpose: This folder/module is responsible for initializing a Sentry client for error tracking and downloading a new IP location database using Redis.
cmd/ip_location.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, encapsulating the functionality related to IP location management and error tracking.

cmd/ip_location/main.go.purpose: This file initializes a Sentry client for error tracking and downloads a new IP location database using Redis.
side_effects: Initializes Sentry for error tracking
Logs errors and process time
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive information in logs
Error handling may not cover all edge cases

cmd/trigger_announcement.purpose: This folder/module is responsible for triggering announcements in a system, initializing configurations, setting up logging, and handling database connections.
cmd/trigger_announcement.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, where the main entry point initializes services and manages dependencies for triggering announcements.

cmd/trigger_announcement/main.go.purpose: This file is the main entry point for triggering announcements in a system, initializing configurations, setting up logging, and handling database connections.
side_effects: Initializes Sentry for error tracking
Connects to a PostgreSQL database
Triggers an announcement based on environment variable
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive information if environment variables are not managed securely
Error handling may not cover all edge cases leading to unhandled exceptions

config.purpose: Configuration management for a service, including loading settings from a config file and setting up logging and HTTP client.
config.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, organizing configuration management into separate files for configuration loading, sensitive data handling, and unit testing.

config/config.go.purpose: Configuration management for a service, including loading settings from a config file and setting up logging and HTTP client.
side_effects: Panic on configuration file read errors
Sets global logging level
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive configuration data if not handled properly

config/config.yml.purpose: Configuration file for a mobile wallet manager application, defining various settings for services, servers, authentication, logging, and other features.
risks: Exposure of sensitive information due to redacted fields
Potential for misconfiguration leading to security vulnerabilities

config/func_print.go.purpose: This file contains functions to hide sensitive data in configuration structures, particularly focusing on fields that may contain secrets like passwords or API keys.
side_effects: Modifies the input data structures to hide sensitive information.
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive data if the hiding functions are not correctly implemented.

config/func_print_test.go.purpose: Unit tests for functions that hide sensitive data in maps and slices.
side_effects: Prints test data to the console
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive data if not handled properly

database/redis.purpose: This folder/module is responsible for creating and managing a Redis client with optional TLS configuration and Prometheus metrics.
database/redis.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, encapsulating Redis client functionality and metrics collection in a single file.

database/redis/redis.go.purpose: This file provides functionality to create and manage a Redis client with optional TLS configuration and Prometheus metrics.
side_effects: Logs connection attempts and errors to Redis server
Registers Prometheus collector for Redis metrics
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive information if logs are not handled properly
Insecure TLS configuration if InsecureSkipVerify is set to true

docs.purpose: This folder is responsible for documentation and configuration related to the HTTP client settings.
docs.architecture: The folder contains a single configuration file in JSON format, indicating a simple structure with low complexity.

docs/http-client.env.json.purpose: Configuration file for HTTP client settings

handlers.purpose: Responsible for handling various operations related to accounts, announcements, devices, DApps, and other services through defined API endpoints.
handlers.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, where each file corresponds to a specific handler for different functionalities, promoting separation of concerns and maintainability.

handlers/account.go.purpose: Handles account-related operations such as retrieving account info, linking accounts, refreshing tokens, and revoking tokens.
side_effects: Modifies HTTP response based on account operations
Logs debug information
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive information in logs
Improper error handling may lead to information leakage

handlers/announcement.go.purpose: This file defines an announcement handler that manages announcements and user preferences through various API endpoints.
side_effects: Interacts with external services to schedule, retrieve, and manage announcements and preferences.
Modifies the state of the system by creating, updating, or deleting announcements and preferences.
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive user data if proper authentication and authorization are not enforced.
Possible denial of service if the service is overwhelmed with requests.

handlers/binance.go.purpose: This file defines a handler for signing requests using the Binance service.

handlers/blacklist.go.purpose: Handles requests related to blacklist sites and returns them in JSON format.
side_effects: Interacts with external services to retrieve blacklist data
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive data if blacklist items are not properly managed

handlers/common.go.purpose: This file defines a common handler for managing configurations and code versions in a web application.
side_effects: Modifies cache for common configurations and code versions.
Publishes events to Redis channels.
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive configuration data if not properly secured.
Race conditions due to concurrent access to shared resources.

handlers/dapp.go.purpose: Handles DApp-related operations such as saving, updating, retrieving, and deleting DApps and highlights.
side_effects: Modifies the state of DApps in the database
Interacts with external services for blacklisting
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive data through error messages
Improper handling of user input may lead to injection attacks

handlers/default.go.purpose: This file defines a handler function to retrieve agent information from the context.

handlers/device.go.purpose: Handles device-related operations such as resetting devices, registering devices, updating push tokens, syncing addresses, and importing wallets.
side_effects: Logs information about device resets.
Asynchronously initializes device registration if not ignoring existing.
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive data in logs if errors occur.
Improper error handling may lead to unhandled exceptions.

handlers/external_auth.go.purpose: Handles external authentication processes, including exchanging auth codes and revoking tokens.
side_effects: Sends HTTP responses based on authentication actions.

handlers/locationhandler.go.purpose: Handles location-related requests and responses for a web service.
side_effects: Logs debug information when looking up location.
risks: Potential exposure of internal service endpoints if not properly secured.
Potential for improper error handling
Dependency on external services for signing URLs

handlers/network.go.purpose: This file defines a network handler for managing network-related operations in a web application.
side_effects: Modifies cache for DApps and contracts based on user agent information.

handlers/releasecandidate.go.purpose: Handles release candidate features and configurations through HTTP requests.

handlers/trusted_domain.go.purpose: Handles trusted domain operations including retrieval, saving, and deletion of trusted domains.
side_effects: Modifies the state of trusted domains in the database
Interacts with external services for blacklist checks
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive domain information
Improper validation could lead to security vulnerabilities

httpclient.purpose: This folder/module is responsible for defining various HTTP clients for interacting with different APIs and managing device-related operations.
httpclient.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, where each file encapsulates a specific client or functionality related to HTTP requests, promoting separation of concerns and reusability.

httpclient/athena.go.purpose: This file defines an HTTP client for linking accounts using the Athena API.
side_effects: Makes HTTP requests to an external API
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive data in HTTP requests
Improper error handling may lead to information leakage

httpclient/device.go.purpose: This file defines a DeviceClient interface and its implementation for managing device-related operations via HTTP requests.
side_effects: Logs a warning if a device is not registered when syncing addresses.
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive information if the SecretKey is not properly managed.

httpclient/internal_client.go.purpose: This file implements an internal HTTP client with HMAC authentication for making requests to a specified URL.
side_effects: Logs request details and errors using zerolog
Modifies HTTP request headers
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive information if SecretKey is logged or mishandled
Improper error handling may lead to information leakage

httpclient/mercury.go.purpose: This file implements a MercuryClient interface for sending notifications via HTTP requests.
side_effects: Logs errors when notification sending fails
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive data in logs if errors occur

httpclient/tracking.go.purpose: Provides a client for tracking requests asynchronously and synchronously.
side_effects: Sends HTTP requests to a tracking server.
risks: Potential exposure of API key in logs or errors.
Asynchronous execution may lead to race conditions.

middleware.purpose: This folder contains middleware components for an Echo web server application, handling various aspects such as error management, authentication, request tracking, and metrics.
middleware.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, where each middleware file encapsulates specific functionalities and can be independently used or combined within the Echo web framework.

middleware/custom_requests_total_prometh.purpose: This file defines a middleware for tracking custom HTTP requests using Prometheus metrics.
side_effects: Registers a new Prometheus counter metric
Logs fatal errors if metric registration fails
risks: Potential logging of sensitive information if user agent data is not handled properly

middleware/error_handler.go.purpose: Handles errors globally for an Echo web server application.
side_effects: Logs error details to the context's logger
Sends JSON response with error details to the client
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive error details in logs
Improper handling of authentication errors could lead to unauthorized access

middleware/internal_auth.go.purpose: This file implements HMAC authentication middleware for validating HMAC signatures in HTTP requests.
side_effects: Modifies HTTP request handling by adding HMAC validation.
risks: Potential for unauthorized access if HMAC validation fails.

middleware/network_api_v1_checking.go.purpose: Defines a middleware function to check if the API version is v1 and sets a context key accordingly.
side_effects: Sets a context key in the echo.Context

middleware/tracking_internal_api.go.purpose: Defines a middleware for tracking API requests in an Echo web framework application.
side_effects: Asynchronously tracks API request data.
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive request data in tracking logs.

middleware/user_agent_parsing.go.purpose: This file provides middleware for parsing user agent strings in a web application.
side_effects: Modifies the context by setting the parsed user agent information.

middleware/wallet_auth.go.purpose: Middleware for verifying wallet signatures in HTTP requests.
side_effects: Logs request information
risks: Potential for unauthorized access if wallet addresses are not properly whitelisted
Signature validation errors may expose sensitive information

migrations.purpose: This folder contains SQL migration scripts responsible for setting up and modifying the database schema for a blockchain-related application.
migrations.architecture: The folder follows a version-controlled migration pattern, where each migration file is timestamped and contains specific changes to the database schema.

migrations/20230407150000_init.sql.purpose: This file contains SQL migration scripts to set up database tables and types for a blockchain-related application.
side_effects: Modifies the database schema by creating tables and types.
Inserts initial data into the tables.
risks: Potential SQL injection if user input is not properly sanitized.
Data integrity risks if foreign key constraints are not enforced.

migrations/20231005150000_add_announceme.purpose: This file contains database migration scripts to create and drop tables related to announcements, special offers, and user preferences.
side_effects: Creates tables and indexes in the database
Modifies the database schema

migrations/20240111120000_alter_preferen.purpose: This file contains migration scripts to alter the preferences table in a database.
side_effects: Modifies the database schema
Changes default values
Creates and drops constraints
risks: Potential data loss during DELETE operation
Risk of breaking existing application functionality due to schema changes

migrations/20240206110000_add_trusted_do.purpose: This file contains SQL migration scripts to create and drop tables for trusted domains and quick access D apps.
side_effects: Creates tables in the database
Creates an index on a table

migrations/20240410140000_add_dapp_highl.purpose: This file contains database migration scripts to modify the schema of a PostgreSQL database, including creating extensions, altering tables, and creating new tables and indexes.
side_effects: Modifies the database schema
Creates new database objects
risks: Potential data loss if not properly backed up before migration
Schema changes may affect application functionality

migrations/20240808130000_alter_preferen.purpose: This file contains migration scripts to create and drop an index on the preferences table.
side_effects: Modifies the database schema by creating or dropping an index.
risks: Potential performance impact on the database during index creation or deletion.

models.purpose: Defines data structures and models for various functionalities related to user accounts, notifications, devices, blockchain interactions, and more.
models.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, where each file defines specific data models and structures related to different application functionalities, promoting separation of concerns.

models/account.go.purpose: Defines request and response structures for user authentication and account linking.

models/announcement.go.purpose: Defines models and structures for handling announcements and related notifications.

models/app.go.purpose: Defines data structures for code version management and request handling.

models/binance.go.purpose: Defines data structures for signing requests and responses for Binance.

models/blacklist.go.purpose: Defines a request structure for getting blacklist sites.

models/chain.go.purpose: Defines a configuration structure for a blockchain chain model.

models/common.go.purpose: Defines data models for common structures used in the application.

models/contract.go.purpose: Defines data structures and methods for handling smart contract information and metadata.

models/default.go.purpose: Defines data structures and methods for handling responses and pagination.

models/device.go.purpose: Defines data structures for device management and requests related to devices.

models/external_auth.go.purpose: Defines data structures for handling external authentication requests and responses.

models/highlight.go.purpose: Defines data structures and methods for managing highlights, including requests and responses for saving and updating highlights.

models/ip_locations.go.purpose: Defines data structures for IP location information and a request structure for retrieving location based on IP.

models/moonpay.go.purpose: Defines data structures for Moonpay signing requests and responses.

models/network.go.purpose: Defines the Network model and related request structures for managing blockchain network data.

models/notification.go.purpose: Defines data structures and constants for managing push notifications and their recipients.

models/preference.go.purpose: Defines data models for user preferences and filters related to device preferences.

models/quickaccess.go.purpose: Defines data structures and methods for managing quick access decentralized applications (DApps).

models/ref_code.go.purpose: Defines data structures and methods for managing referral codes and wallets.

models/releasecandidate.go.purpose: Defines request structures for feature management in a device context.

models/trusted_domain.go.purpose: Defines data structures and methods for managing trusted domains in an application.

models/useragent.go.purpose: Defines a structure for user agent information and provides a method to check if the agent information is empty.

pkg/announcement.purpose: This folder/module is responsible for managing announcements, including scheduling and retrieving them.
pkg/announcement.architecture: The folder follows a service-oriented architecture pattern, encapsulating the announcement management logic within dedicated service and configuration files.

pkg/announcement/announcement_svc.go.purpose: This file implements a service for managing announcements, including scheduling and retrieving them.
side_effects: Uploads images to GCS
Deletes images from GCS on error
risks: Potential for file upload vulnerabilities
Improper handling of image types may lead to security issues

pkg/announcement/config.go.purpose: Defines configuration structures for an announcement service, including communication, storage, and Kubernetes settings.

pkg/binance.purpose: Responsible for handling Binance-specific configurations and services, particularly for signing payloads using ECDSA.
pkg/binance.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, encapsulating configuration and service logic related to Binance in separate files.

pkg/binance/config.go.purpose: Defines a configuration structure for Binance with a private key.

pkg/binance/service.go.purpose: Provides a service for signing payloads using ECDSA.
risks: Potential exposure of private key if not handled securely

pkg/blacklist.purpose: Responsible for managing blacklisted sites and feature flags based on user agent information.
pkg/blacklist.architecture: The folder follows a service-oriented architecture pattern, encapsulating configuration and service logic for blacklist management.

pkg/blacklist/config.go.purpose: Defines configuration structures for managing blacklists and feature flags.

pkg/blacklist/service.go.purpose: Provides a service for managing blacklisted sites and feature flags based on user agent information.

pkg/crypto/hmac.purpose: Responsible for HMAC signing and validation functionalities, including configuration management and unit testing.
pkg/crypto/hmac.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, encapsulating HMAC-related functionalities and configurations, with separate files for implementation and testing.

pkg/crypto/hmac/config.go.purpose: Defines a configuration structure for HMAC with normalization of whitelist addresses.
side_effects: Modifies the WhitelistAddresses field of the Config struct.

pkg/crypto/hmac/funcs.go.purpose: Provides HMAC signing functions using SHA256 and SHA512 algorithms.
risks: Potential for cryptographic vulnerabilities if used improperly.

pkg/crypto/hmac/funcs_test.go.purpose: Unit tests for the HMAC signing functionality.

pkg/crypto/hmac/hmac.go.purpose: Provides HMAC validation functionality including signature verification and clock skew validation.
side_effects: Prints error messages to console if parsing time fails
risks: Potential for time manipulation attacks if clock skew is not properly validated

pkg/crypto/hmac/hmac_test.go.purpose: Unit tests for HMAC validation functions, checking clock skew and signature validation.

pkg/crypto/hmac/init.go.purpose: This file initializes a singleton instance of the HMAC structure with a configuration.
side_effects: Initializes a global instance of HMAC
Sets global configuration
risks: Potential race conditions if InitInstance is called concurrently without proper synchronization

pkg/dapp.purpose: Responsible for managing decentralized applications (dApps) including configuration, service management, and CRUD operations.
pkg/dapp.architecture: The folder follows a service-oriented architecture pattern, focusing on modular services for dApp management.

pkg/dapp/config.go.purpose: Defines a configuration structure for a decentralized application.

pkg/dapp/d_app_svc.go.purpose: This file defines a service for managing quick access decentralized applications (dApps) and highlights, including CRUD operations and caching mechanisms.
side_effects: Publishing messages to refresh cache asynchronously

pkg/device.purpose: Responsible for managing device-related services and configurations.
pkg/device.architecture: The folder follows a service-oriented architecture, encapsulating device management functionalities and configurations in separate files.

pkg/device/config.go.purpose: Defines configuration structures for device services.

pkg/device/service.go.purpose: Provides a service interface for managing devices, including operations like getting, resetting, and creating devices.

pkg/gcs.purpose: Responsible for interacting with Google Cloud Storage to manage file operations such as uploading, deleting, and downloading files.
pkg/gcs.architecture: The folder follows a service-oriented architecture pattern, encapsulating configuration and service logic for Google Cloud Storage operations.

pkg/gcs/config.go.purpose: Defines a configuration structure for Google Cloud Storage.

pkg/gcs/service.go.purpose: Provides a service for uploading, deleting, and downloading files to/from Google Cloud Storage.
side_effects: Interacts with Google Cloud Storage to perform file operations.
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive data if file URLs are not properly secured.

pkg/helper.purpose: Provides various utility functions for encryption, file handling, token generation, and data manipulation in a Go application.
pkg/helper.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, encapsulating related functionalities into separate files for better maintainability and reusability.

pkg/helper/aes.go.purpose: Provides functions for AES encryption of messages using a given key.
side_effects: Generates random initialization vector (IV) for encryption
May modify input data during encryption
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive data if key is weak
Improper handling of errors may lead to information leakage

pkg/helper/binder.go.purpose: Provides functionality to bind multipart file uploads to struct fields in an Echo web framework context.
side_effects: Modifies struct fields based on multipart file uploads.
risks: Potential for reflection-based errors if the input type is not as expected.

pkg/helper/hmac_token.go.purpose: Generates an HMAC access token for authentication purposes.
risks: Potential exposure of secret if not handled properly

pkg/helper/pointer.go.purpose: Defines a generic function to create a pointer to a value of any type.

pkg/helper/random.go.purpose: Generates a random string of specified length using alphanumeric characters.
risks: Potential for cryptographic weaknesses if not used properly.

pkg/helper/ronin.go.purpose: Provides utility functions for normalizing Ethereum addresses, hashing messages, and validating signatures.
risks: Potential for signature forgery if inputs are not properly validated.

pkg/helper/slice.go.purpose: Provides utility functions for filtering and transforming slices.

pkg/helper/tls.go.purpose: This file provides a function to convert certificate and key data into a TLS configuration.

pkg/location.purpose: Responsible for managing IP location data and configuration settings related to the location package.
pkg/location.architecture: The folder follows a service-oriented architecture, encapsulating configuration and service logic for IP location management.

pkg/location/config.go.purpose: Defines a configuration structure for the location package, including database URLs and file names.

pkg/location/location_svc.go.purpose: Provides a service for retrieving IP location data and managing the database of such data.
side_effects: Downloads and stores IP location database files.
Publishes events to Redis for database refresh.

pkg/moonpay.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, encapsulating configuration and service logic in separate files for maintainability and clarity.

pkg/moonpay/config.go.purpose: Defines a configuration structure for Moonpay with a secret field.
risks: Exposure of sensitive information if the secret is not properly managed

pkg/moonpay/service.go.purpose: Provides a service for signing URLs using a configuration.

pkg/preference.purpose: This folder/module is responsible for managing user preferences related to a wallet application, including fetching and updating preferences based on device and address.
pkg/preference.architecture: The folder follows a service-oriented architecture pattern, encapsulating the logic for user preferences management within a dedicated service file.

pkg/preference/pref_svc.go.purpose: This file defines a service for managing user preferences related to a wallet application, including fetching and updating preferences based on device and address.
side_effects: Logs information and errors during preference migration and updates.
Asynchronously migrates notification settings for devices.

pkg/releasecandidate/init.go.purpose: Defines a service interface for managing feature configurations and whitelist devices.

pkg/tracking/config.go.purpose: Defines a configuration structure for tracking with associated methods.

pkg/worker/config.go.purpose: Defines a configuration structure for a worker package.

pkg/worker/dispatcher.go.purpose: This file implements a Dispatcher that manages a pool of worker goroutines to process jobs concurrently.
side_effects: Starts goroutines for workers
Blocks until a worker is available for a job
risks: Potential deadlock if jobQueue is full and no workers are available

pkg/worker/job.go.purpose: Defines a Job struct with an executable function.

pkg/worker/worker.go.purpose: This file defines a Worker type that manages job execution in a worker pool.
side_effects: Starts a goroutine for job processing
Logs errors during job execution

Improper handling of quit signals may lead to resource leaks

repositories.purpose: This folder contains repository definitions for managing various entities in a database, including announcements, code versions, contracts, decentralized applications, highlights, networks, user preferences, quick access DApps, and trusted domains.
repositories.architecture: The folder follows a repository pattern, encapsulating database access logic for different entities and providing a clear interface for CRUD operations.

repositories/announcement.go.purpose: This file defines a repository for managing announcements, including CRUD operations and special offer logs.
side_effects: Database transactions for creating, updating, and deleting announcements and special offers.

repositories/code_version.go.purpose: This file defines a repository for managing code versions, including retrieving and saving versions to a database.
side_effects: Database transactions are initiated and may modify the database state.
risks: Potential SQL injection if inputs are not properly sanitized.
Error handling may expose sensitive information if not managed correctly.

repositories/common.go.purpose: This file defines a repository interface and its implementation for managing common entities in a database using GORM.
side_effects: Database transactions are initiated and may modify the database state.
risks: Potential SQL injection if user input is not properly sanitized.
Data loss if 'overwriteOnConflict' is not handled correctly.

repositories/contract.go.purpose: This file defines a repository interface and its implementation for managing contract data in a database.
side_effects: Database transactions are initiated and may modify the database state.
risks: Potential SQL injection if filter conditions are not properly sanitized.
Panic calls in unimplemented methods may lead to application crashes.

repositories/dapp.go.purpose: This file defines a repository interface and its implementation for managing decentralized applications (DApps) in a database.
side_effects: Database transactions are performed for creating, updating, and deleting DApps.
risks: Potential for SQL injection if filter conditions are not properly sanitized.
Panic calls in unimplemented methods could lead to application crashes.

repositories/highlight.go.purpose: This file defines a repository for managing highlights in a database using GORM.
side_effects: Database transactions are performed which may modify the state of the database.
risks: Potential SQL injection if inputs are not properly sanitized.
Data integrity issues if concurrent updates are not handled correctly.

repositories/init.go.purpose: Provides pagination functionality for database queries using GORM.

repositories/network.go.purpose: This file defines a repository interface and its implementation for managing network entities in a database.
side_effects: Database transactions are initiated and may modify the database state.
risks: Potential SQL injection if filter conditions are not properly sanitized.
Panic in SaveNetwork, UpdateNetworks, and SaveNetworks if not implemented.

repositories/preference.go.purpose: This file defines a repository for managing user preferences in a database using GORM.
side_effects: Database operations that modify user preferences.
risks: Potential SQL injection if user input is not properly sanitized.

repositories/quickaccess.go.purpose: This file defines a repository for managing Quick Access DApps, including CRUD operations and searching functionalities.
side_effects: Database transactions are performed which may affect the state of the database.
risks: Potential SQL injection if user input is not properly sanitized in search queries.

repositories/trusted_domain.go.purpose: This file defines a repository for managing trusted domains in a database using GORM.
side_effects: Database transactions are initiated and may modify the database state.
risks: Potential SQL injection if user input is not properly sanitized in queries.

root.purpose: This folder/module is responsible for managing the wallet-manager project, including configuration, documentation, and service definitions.
root.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, organizing configuration, documentation, and service definitions for a Dockerized application.

.golangci.yaml.purpose: Configuration file for GolangCI-Lint, specifying linter settings and rules.

SECURITY.md.purpose: Document the security policy and supported versions of the project.

country_iso2_to_currency.json.purpose: This file maps country ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 codes to their respective currencies.

country_iso2_to_iso3.json.purpose: This file maps ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country codes to their corresponding ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 country codes.

docker-compose.yml.purpose: Defines services for a Docker application including PostgreSQL and Redis.
side_effects: Creates Docker containers for PostgreSQL and Redis services.
risks: Exposing database ports may lead to unauthorized access if not properly secured.

entrypoint.sh.purpose: This script serves as an entry point to run a service application.
side_effects: Executes an external application './app' with passed arguments.

routes.purpose: Responsible for setting up and managing routes for an Echo web server, including public, private, and internal API functionalities.
routes.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, organizing routes into separate files for public, private, and internal APIs, each handling specific functionalities and utilizing middleware for security and logging.

routes/init.go.purpose: Sets up routes for an Echo web server, initializes database clients, and registers handlers for various services.
side_effects: Establishes database connections
Registers HTTP routes
risks: Potential for database connection leaks if not handled properly
Error handling may lead to application crashes if not managed

routes/internal.go.purpose: Defines internal routes for a wallet manager API, handling various network and announcement functionalities.
side_effects: Modifies the state of the API by registering routes and middleware.
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive data if routes are not properly secured.

routes/private.go.purpose: Defines routes for private wallet management functionalities in an Echo web server.
side_effects: Creates HTTP routes for handling wallet management requests.
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive wallet management operations if not properly secured.

routes/public.go.purpose: Defines public API routes for a wallet manager application, including health checks and various resource endpoints.
side_effects: Modifies the state of the application by registering routes and handlers.
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive information through API endpoints if not properly secured.

tests.purpose: This folder contains tests for the web server that provides an endpoint to sign messages using ECDSA.
tests.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, focusing on the implementation of a web server with a clear separation of concerns for handling requests and signing messages.

tests/main.go.purpose: This file implements a web server that provides an endpoint to sign messages using ECDSA.
side_effects: Starts an HTTP server
Listens for OS interrupt signals to gracefully shut down
risks: Potential exposure of private keys if not handled securely
Logging sensitive information
